decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly flood the board with aggressive Human creatures, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with disruptive cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and resilient board presence, utilizing cards like Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and maximize mana efficiency. The synergy between Human tribal effects and powerful individual creature abilities allows for both a wide variety of threats and a high degree of disruption against opposing strategies.

The main idea of this deck is to use a combination of mana-producing Elves and cards like Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This mana can then be used to cast big creatures like Ezuri, Renegade Leader and activate its ability multiple times in a turn, overwhelming the opponent with a massive army of buffed Elves. Cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling help find key pieces of the combo, while lands like Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx can further boost the mana production.

The main concept of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient creature strategy. By utilizing cards like Collected Company and Path to Exile, the deck can quickly deploy threats such as Courser of Kruphix, Knight of the Reliquary, and Voice of Resurgence. The deck also includes cards like Ramunap Excavator and Ghost Quarter for land disruption, as well as cards like Worship for protection. With a focus on fast creature plays and disruptive tactics, this deck aims to apply early pressure and control the board to secure a quick victory.

This UW Control deck focuses on using counterspells, removal, and card advantage to control the game and out-value opponents. The deck includes key cards like Cryptic Command and Supreme Verdict to control the board, along with efficient removal like Path to Exile. Card selection and advantage are gained through Serum Visions and Search for Azcanta. The deck also includes win conditions like Celestial Colonnade and planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through disruption and powerful spells until it can secure a win.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It aims to efficiently deal with threats using cards like Path to Exile, Lightning Bolt, and Cryptic Command while also generating card advantage with Snapcaster Mage and Search for Azcanta. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provides additional card advantage and control, while Celestial Colonnade offers a strong win condition. The deck's mana base is designed to support its control elements, ensuring that it can consistently and effectively control the game until it can secure victory.

This deck relies on self-discard to quickly fill the graveyard, enabling efficient and explosive plays with cheap, powerful creatures like Hollow One, Flamewake Phoenix, and Gurmag Angler. Utilizing cards like Goblin Lore and Faithless Looting, the deck aims to be fast and aggressive, overwhelming opponents before they have time to set up their own game plan. With a mix of direct damage spells and recurring threats, this deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out games quickly.

This deck aims to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand, and then cheat them into play using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Living End. By combining graveyard manipulation and powerful reanimation spells, the deck can overwhelm opponents with big threats early in the game. Cards like Faithless Looting and Ancestral Vision help to dig for combo pieces, while As Foretold allows for free casting of spells to further exploit the graveyard strategy. The deck also has some control elements with cards like Lightning Axe and Izzet Charm to disrupt opponents' plans.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to control the board and opponent's resources through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. With cards like Cryptic Command, Mana Leak, and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while using powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon Jura to provide additional threats and card advantage. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Path to Exile and Terminus, as well as powerful card draw spells like Sphinx's Revelation and Search for Azcanta to outlast the opponent in a long game.

The main concept of this Aggro - Affinity deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with an army of artifact creatures, fueled by cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum. Cranial Plating boosts the power of these creatures, while Galvanic Blast provides direct damage to finish off the opponent. Steel Overseer and Karn, Scion of Urza provide additional support and card advantage. By utilizing artifact lands like Darksteel Citadel and creature lands like Inkmoth Nexus, this deck aims to quickly build a powerful board presence and close out the game before the opponent has a chance to recover.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards, enabling the player to cast powerful creatures like Hollow One for little or no mana. By utilizing cards like Goblin Lore, Faithless Looting, and Burning Inquiry, the deck aims to quickly dump cards into the graveyard while also providing options for card draw and removal. The creatures in the deck, such as Flamewake Phoenix and Gurmag Angler, also benefit from being able to be cast for reduced costs due to the graveyard being filled. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with quick and powerful creature plays.

This deck focuses on slowing down the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal spells, and card draw. By using cards like Cryptic Command, Path to Exile, and Snapcaster Mage, it aims to control the board while gradually gaining card advantage. Teferi, Hero of Dominaria provides additional card advantage and disruption, while Search for Azcanta helps filter through the deck. The deck also includes burn spells like Lightning Helix and Lightning Bolt for additional removal and reach. The goal is to outvalue the opponent and eventually win the game with a secure advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By combining ramp with Noble Hierarch and Eldrazi Temple, the deck aims to play powerful threats like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer ahead of curve. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Lightning Bolt and Ancient Grudge for removal and disruption, as well as card advantage with Bloodbraid Elf. The inclusion of cards like Thragtusk and Endbringer provide additional value and versatility in different matchups. Overall, the deck focuses on fast and efficient creature beatdowns to achieve victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts and artifacts synergy to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. It combines cheap artifact creatures with artifact-enhancing cards like Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer to create a powerful board presence. The inclusion of burn spells like Galvanic Blast provides reach to finish off the opponent. The deck aims to win the game quickly and efficiently by utilizing the affinity mechanic to deploy threats faster than the opponent can respond.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with cards like Goblin Lore, Faithless Looting, and Burning Inquiry to enable the casting of Hollow One for free. Additionally, the deck utilizes aggressive creatures like Flamewake Phoenix, Flameblade Adept, and Bloodghast to apply early pressure on the opponent. Cards like Lightning Bolt and Collective Brutality provide removal and disruption, while Gurmag Angler serves as a powerful late-game threat. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and consistent aggro strategy fueled by graveyard manipulation.

This deck aims to flood the board with artifacts quickly, using cards like Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to power out powerful threats like Cranial Plating and Signal Pest. With cards like Inkmoth Nexus and Arcbound Ravager, the deck can quickly close out games by overwhelming the opponent with threats. The inclusion of cards like Galvanic Blast and Vault Skirge provide additional reach and resilience to removal spells. Steel Overseer helps to further pump up the team, while Blinkmoth Nexus and Etched Champion offer evasion and protection, respectively. This deck can quickly apply pressure and close out games before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating incremental advantage through cards like Snapcaster Mage, Liliana, the Last Hope, and Search for Azcanta. By efficiently answering threats and drawing cards, the deck is able to grind out the opponent until it can close out the game with powerful finishers like Tasigur, the Golden Fang and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. The land base is designed to support the control elements of the deck and provide consistent mana for its spells.
